title: MERRY-GO-ROUNDS; SWINGS; ROCKING-HORSES; CHUTES; SWITCHBACKS; SIMILAR DEVICES FOR PUBLIC AMUSEMENT
definition_statement: This place covers: Roundabouts, up-and-down hill tracks, swings, see-saws, rocking-horses, toy animals for riding, chutes, rotating or rocking pots, bumper cars, Russian swings, Ferris wheels, rolling drums and amusement arrangements in general, e.g. playground appliances.

title: rotated by pushing the feet against a fixed surface or by running
with seats performing movements in a horizontal plane, other than circular movements
with turntables moved up and down
with turntables and movably-mounted vehicles thereon which move to the outside when the roundabout is rotated
Water roundabouts, e.g. freely floating
informative_references: Training appliances or apparatus for surfing, i.e. without a sail; for skate or snow boarding  Design or layout of playing courts, rinks, bowling greens or areas for water-skiing; Covers therefor

title: Accessories for roundabouts not restricted to one of groups A63G1/00 or A63G3/00
Up-and-down hill tracks; Switchbacks
informative_references: Tracks for special kinds of railways

title: Swings
informative_references: Rocking chairs pivotally mounted in a frame; Swings  Nursery furniture: Rocking chairs; Indoor swings; Baby bouncers

title: Special fastenings of the suspensory point
Driving mechanisms, such as ropes, gear, belt, motor drive
Cradle swings; Rocking-horses; Like devices resting on the ground
mounted on links or springs
definition_statement: This place covers: Mounted on links contemplates, for instance, elastic links and other types of mechanical links that allow rocking motions.

title: with dismountable runners usable for other purposes
informative_references: Vehicles having alternatively-usable runners and wheels
definition_statement: This place covers: Rocking-horses with any type of dismountable runners directed to add further functionalities and usability to the rocking-horses

title: Rocking horses on runners adapted for progressive movement
Toy animals for riding
informative_references: Children vehicles hand carried by adult  Children's cycles

title: Swingably-mounted toy animals for riding made to travel by means of parallelogram-joints
made to travel by ratchet-wheels, e.g. by stretching the legs
by pressing the seats or saddles up-and-down
by moving the stirrups or pedals
made to travel by pacing
definition_statement: This place covers: Toy animals for riding propelled by foot power

title: Chutes; Helter-skelters
glossary_of_terms: Helter-skeltersA funfair amusement park ride with a slide built in a spiral around a high tower. Users climb up inside the tower and slide down the outside, usually on a mat or sack.

title: with driven slideways
definition_statement: This place covers: Chutes with driven slideways, i.e. slideways or part of the slideways that are suitable to be moved from one position to another one.

title: with forced removal of the passenger from the seat
Water-chutes
informative_references: Training appliances or apparatus for surfing, i.e. without a sail; for skate or snow boarding  Design or layout of playing courts, rinks, bowling greens or areas for water-skiing; Covers therefor

title: Slideways with movably suspended cars, or with cars moving on ropes, or the like
informative_references: Elevated railway systems with suspended vehicles

title: Rotating or rocking pots{, e.g. by moving the whole body  (rotating or rocking exercising for training agility or coordination of movements A63B22/14, A63B22/16, A63B22/18)}
informative_references: Rotating or rocking exercising for training agility or coordination of movements , ,

with special movements of the seat-carriers

with seats staying at the bottom of the drum

title: with jolting substructures
definition_statement: This place covers: Jolting substructures, e.g. providing for rough motion, sudden abrupt movement.

with looping, hopping, or throwing motions of the substructure

title: Devices allowing competitions between several persons, not otherwise provided for
